page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: Lapford lies right beside the{main {routes}between Exeter and Barnstaple, right in the middle of the country. Seven {trains}run each day to and from Exeter and the return fare is Â£3, while six trains go to Barnstaple with the fare Â£3.50.Two {buses}go to and from Exeter each day and the return fare is 85p, while the fare is Â£1.20 to Barnstaple.it takes about half an hour by {train}or {bus}to Exeter and 45 minutes to Barnstaple. Most people travel by {car}though, and only two families in our school do not have a car.The {main road}to Exeter was built in 1825 when it was a toll road and the {railway}was laid in 1855.
